alert.note: Alert for Gosper (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 9:40PM CDT until September 22 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FRIDAY FOR GOSPER COUNTY... At 940 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain from thunderstorms across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bertrand, Elwood, Smithfield and Johnson Lake. The heaviest rain has issued, but runoff will continue to lead to flooding issues into tonight. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
